title: 110_s2471
content: The "USERRA Enforcement Improvement Act of 2007" is the short title of this Act. It aims to reform the USERRA complaint process. The USERRA Enforcement Improvement Act of 2007 aims to reform the complaint process by expediting the investigation and resolution of complaints, as well as providing notification of rights and technical assistance to claimants. The Secretary must complete actions related to complaints within 90 days of receipt. The USERRA Enforcement Improvement Act of 2007 expedites the referral process for complaints to the Attorney General and special counsel within 15 days of receipt. The Attorney General must provide notification of representation within 45 days of receiving a referral. The USERRA Enforcement Improvement Act of 2007 requires the Attorney General and special counsel to make a decision on representation within 45 days of receiving a referral. SEC. 3. EXPANSION OF REPORTING REQUIREMENTS WITH RESPECT TO ENFORCEMENT OF USERRA. Modification of Annual Report by Secretary under title 38, United States Code includes reporting on cases reviewed by the Secretary of Defense through the National Committee for Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve, specifically focusing on disability-related issues. The modification of the annual report under title 38, United States Code includes reporting on disability-related issues in cases reviewed by the Secretary of Defense. The Comptroller General of the United States is required to submit quarterly reports to Congress and other relevant parties regarding these issues. The Special Counsel and the Attorney General must report on cases where referral requirements were not met within specified time periods. The Secretary will coordinate with other agencies to ensure uniform categorization of data in reports required by the section, and electronic access to case files. The amendments made by this section will apply to reports required after the enactment of the Act.
